articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Visit Siberia and Far Eastern Region of Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Visit Siberia and Far Eastern Region of Russia

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Chairman Kim Jong Il of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea will pay an unofficial visit to Siberia and Far Eastern region of the Russian Federation at the invitation of Dmitri Anatoliyevich Medvedev, president of the Russian Federation.
					
					During the visit the top leaders of the two countries will have a meeting.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Passes through Khasan Railway Station, Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Passes through Khasan Railway Station, Russia

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, passed through Khasan, the border railway station of Russia this morning on his way to pay an unofficial visit to Siberia and the Far East Region of the Russian Federation at the invitation of Dmitri Anatoliyevich Medvedev, president of the Russian Federation.
					
					He was greeted at Khasan Railway Station by Viktor Ishayev, presidential envoy to the Far East Region of the Russian Federation, who came to Khasan to conduct him.
					
					He was also greeted by Sergey Darikin, governor of Maritime Territory, Valery Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, Irina Skorobogatova, deputy governor of Maritime Territory, and other senior officials of Moscow, maritime territory, city and district.
					
					When the train pulled in the station, the senior officials got on the train and offered greetings to him.
					
					Medvedev, who has paid deep attention to the Russia-DPRK friendship, dispatched them to greet Kim Jong Il, Viktor Ishayev and other senior officials said, warmly welcoming him to Russia upon the authorization of its President.
					
					Kim Jong Il's current visit to Russia will mark a historic occasion in putting the Russia-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations onto a fresher and higher stage, they noted.
					
					He said he was very pleased to see for himself the achievements made by the diligent and resourceful Russian people through his current visit, thanking the senior officials of Moscow and local areas and people for warmly greeting him.
					
					He was presented with a souvenir by Sergey Darikin on behalf of the Maritime Territorial Government and people.
					
					After a while, he left for his destination amid send-off by senior officials of Russia.
					
					Prior to it, he left the country to pay an unofficial visit to Siberia and the Far East Region of the Russian Federation.
					
					He is accompanied by Kim Yong Chun, member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and vice-premier of the Cabinet, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and vice-chairman of the NDC, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun and Thae Jong Su, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the WPK Central Committee, Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the WPK Central Committee, Pak Pong Ju, first vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, O Su Yong, chief secretary of the North Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK, Kim Kye Gwan, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Yong Jae, DPRK ambassador to Russia, and Sim Kuk Ryong, consul general of the DPRK Consulate General in Nakhodka of Russia.
					
					His visit to Russia, another event in achieving world peace and security and the human cause of independence, will mark a historic occasion in boosting the DPRK-Russia friendship given steady continuity generation after generation and putting strong impetus to the drive of all the servicepersons and people to build a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Reply to Belarusian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Reply to Belarusian President

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, Saturday sent a reply message to Aleksandr Lukashenko, president of Belarus. 
					
					The message said:
					
					I express thanks to you for your message of sympathy sent in connection with the floods that hit some parts of the DPRK, causing damage. 
					
					Availing myself of this opportunity, I wish you success in your work for economic stability of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Hungarian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Hungarian President

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greeting to Schmitt Pal, Hungarian president, on its national day.
					
					Kim in the message wished him success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Urban Management led by its Vice-Minister Ri Kang Hui left here Saturday to visit China.

articles.title: Preparations for World Taekwon-Do Championship Near Completion
articles.content:
Preparations for World Taekwon-Do Championship Near Completion

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- The 17th World Taekwon-Do Championship will be held in Pyongyang from September 6 to 12.
					
					An estimated 80 countries and regions have applied for the championship.
					
					The championship's emblem inscribed with the DPRK flag, Taekwon-Do Hall and Taekwon-Do movements, has already been prepared, along with trophies, diplomas and medals.
					
					Materials are also ready for the competitors in their training and matches. 
					
					The organizing committee, in cooperation with relevant organs, has taken measures to fully provide lodging, traffic and tourist conditions to the players, coaches and those coming from other countries to enjoy the matches. 
					
					It is also keeping in touch with national Taekwon-Do associations of other countries for a successful sponsorship of the championship.
					
					Opening and closing ceremonies and other events to be held during the tournament will help develop Taekwon-Do techniques and arouse worldwide interest in Taekwon-Do.

articles.title: Achievements in Fish Farming
articles.content:
Achievements in Fish Farming

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Successes have been made in fish farming in the DPRK recently.
					
					The field of pisciculture has reconstructed or built thousands of fish breeding grounds and put them on a scientific and technical basis in the last two years.
					
					It modernized fry breeding farms and increased the production of fries 1.5 times.
					
					Fish farms across the country completed in the main the modernization of gravity-fed hatcheries.
					
					Fish breeding grounds covering dozens of hectares and more than a hundred ponds have been built on the shores of Ryongyon and in the vicinity of the Ryongjong Spring. Vast man-made lakes of Ryesonggang Youth Power Station No. 1, the Samsu Power Station and the areas of Huichon and Ryongrim are teeming with shoals of fish, presenting fantastic scenery.
					
					Fish breeding grounds using cold and warm waters made their appearances in Rinsan, Singye, Myonggan and Kilju and other counties to breed catfish and rainbow trout.
					
					The production of fries rapidly increased through innovations in the work for solving the issue of food.
					
					The Tudan Fry Breeding Office, the Taedonggang Fish Farming Office, the Yonggwang Youth Fish Farming Office and other offices produced two or three times as many young fishes in the last two years as compared with the preceding years and released them into rivers and lakes.
					
					Scientists and researchers succeeded in introducing fast-growing Ryongjong fish across the country and made progress in studying and breeding new species.
					
					They solved technical issues ranging from breeding mother fish to collecting and hatching eggs and breeding fries and fattening them.  They succeeded in rounding off the process of breeding sturgeon and putting the method of breeding salmon on a scientific basis to suit the actual conditions of the country.
					
					A scientific fish breeding system is introduced across the country. Fishes are distributed in water of different layers to suit their physiological characteristics to make a three dimensional use of production area. Use of water, supply of food and the density of fish habitation are scientifically adjudged.

articles.title: Golden Jubilee of Pyongyang Hotel
articles.content:
Golden Jubilee of Pyongyang Hotel

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang Hotel overlooking the River Taedong was established on August 19, 1961.
					
					The hotel having more than 200 rooms, banquet hall, dinning rooms, cinema and tea rooms, etc., meets modern architectural taste. 
					
					Over the past 50 years, the hotel has made good service to participants in the 13th World Youth and Student Festival and the April Spring Friendship Art Festival and spectators of grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" and other guests.
					
					More than 346 000 compatriots of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and other overseas compatriots and foreigners were guests of the hotel in the last decade.
					
					The hotel is famous for its high level of cooking.
					
					There were just over 150 kinds of dishes at the time of its opening but now it serves guests more than 2 000 kinds of national food and world-famous dishes.
					
					Its cooks were honored to receive many medals and diplomas in the April holiday cooking festival, an annual event. 
					
					A meeting and other events were held at the hotel on Thursday to mark its golden jubilee.

articles.title: Many Literary and Art Works Produced in DPRK
articles.content:
Many Literary and Art Works Produced in DPRK

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Activities for creating articles and paintings on the theme of class education are brisk among working people and school youth and children in various parts of the DPRK.
					
					They have created more than 1 000 articles and paintings reflecting the firm faith and will of the army and people of the DPRK to shatter the reckless moves of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet group of traitors to ignite a war and achieve the final victory in the confrontation with the enemy.
					
					They include real story "We Will Settle Accounts with the Enemy to the Last", essays "Father's Appearance" and "Recalling the Word 'Missing'", poems "Growing Fist" and "Fire Wick" and other works created by officials of the youth league, teachers and school youth and children out of burning hatred for the enemy.
					
					Real story "Braid of Hair" and poem "Oh, My Comrade of the Same Age" tell people that the enemy remains unchanged in his true nature and any illusion about imperialism precisely means death.

articles.title: Construction Makes Rapid Progress in Mansudae Area of Pyongyang
articles.content:
Construction Makes Rapid Progress in Mansudae Area of Pyongyang

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- The construction is making rapid progress in the Mansudae area here.
					
					The framework for nearly 1 000 flats has been completed and work is now under way above 10-20 floors at an increasing number of housing projects.
					
					Signal successes are reported from various construction sites. Groundwork of various public buildings and public catering establishments was completed and wall concrete tamping is making brisk headway.
					
					Soldier-builders are performing feats in the construction of apartment framework after completing vast groundwork for skyscraping apartment houses in a brief span of time. 
					
					The Construction Regiment of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, the Ryongsan Construction Division and other units engaged in building skyscraping apartment houses are also registering successes.
					
					The unit under the General Bureau of Capital Construction was the first finished.

articles.title: Soft Bean Curd Food Enjoys Popularity in Korea
articles.content:
Soft Bean Curd Food Enjoys Popularity in Korea

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- The bean curd restaurant located in Central District, Pyongyang, draws many customers.
					
					The restaurant serves tens of bean curd food, including soup, broiled, fried and hard-boiled dishes and broth.
					
					Bean curd breaks into uncurdled, square, fermented, frozen and soft ones. 
					
					Soft bean curd, with functional substances included in it, helps prevent cancer, dissolve cholesterol and raise immunity.
					
					It is also used in making bread, pancake and sausage.

articles.title: "Song of Red Flag" Sung by President Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
"Song of Red Flag" Sung by President Kim Il Sung

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung gave field guidance to the Kangson Steel Plant in December Juche 45 (1956) when the country was undergoing harsh ordeals just three years after the end of the Korean war.
					
					During the field guidance the President told the plant's workers that the country would feel relief if they produced 10 000 tonnes more steel.
					
					In response to his remark, they vowed to produce more than 10 000 tonnes.
					
					Leaving the plant, he, deeply moved by their resolution, sang "Song of Red Flag" with confidence in the Korean people.
					
					 
					
					Let cowards flinch and traitors sheer, 
					
					We'll keep the Red Flag flying here
					
					 
					
					In the whole course of the Korean revolution, he always overcame difficulties and trials, relying on the people.

articles.title: War Exercises Can Never Help Improve Inter-Korean Relations: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
War Exercises Can Never Help Improve Inter-Korean Relations: Rodong Sinmun

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Distrust and confrontation are bound to escalate while war exercises are under way and they can never help improve the inter-Korean relations.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in a bylined article.
					
					The south Korean authorities' racket for military confrontation is a revelation of their extreme mistrust and hostility toward fellow countrymen, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					Confrontation is bound to disturb peace on the Korean Peninsula and lead the inter-Korean relations to catastrophe. This is the lesson taught by what happened in the last three and half years.
					
					Persistent provocations in south Korea such as Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises would only give impetus to evil cycle of distrust and confrontation between the north and the south. No one can vouch that these maneuvers would not lead to a war.
					
					War exercises can never go with peace.
					
					It is only traitors to the country and nation that head for confrontation and war.
					
					It is a great miscalculation for them to think that in case of a war on the peninsula south Korea would be safe.
					
					Military standoff will never be a way out for them. Confrontation and war are bound to bring the warmongers to an end.

articles.title: Confidence Building, Key to Ensure Peace on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Confidence Building, Key to Ensure Peace on Korean Peninsula

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- The world today is witnessing a phase of detente and positive changes in which regional disputes find political solutions through dialogue.
					
					But it is only the Korean Peninsula where tensions and danger of war persist.
					
					In this regard, the Chinese Magazine Liaowang in its 32nd issue carried an article titled "Lack of confidence is the problem in the security situation in the Korean Peninsula."
					
					It said:
					
					In the wake of recent contact between the north and the south and that between the DPRK and the U.S., in particular, a clear sign of detente was likely to show in the security situation in the Korean Peninsula which witnessed serious unrest and even reached the brink of a war in 2010 and there was a ray of hope for the resumption of the six-party talks.
					
					In the light of a series of periodical cycles of "talks" and "crisis" on the Korean Peninsula people cannot but be cautious about the future trend of the situation on the peninsula.
					
					Uncertainty of the security situation on the peninsula and its actual and potential danger originated from the lack of confidence between those involved in the conflict.
					
					There is the lack of mutual confidence between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					The U.S. side does not fully respect the regime in the DPRK though it actually exists. The former has long regarded the latter as a state of other category, far from paying attention and taking into consideration on a strategic level its requirements of interests and security.
					
					The main purpose of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK is to encircle and stifle it politically, impose economic sanctions on it and put strategic pressure on it through regular Ulji Freedom Guardian and other joint military exercises in the military aspect.
					
					The U.S. does not hesitate to pursue "brink of war" policy. The DPRK-U.S. relations still remain in the grip of acute confrontation color though there was once a temporary sign of detente during the office of Clinton. The U.S. arms race and military drills, in particular, have been considered as hostility and offensive posture, straining the situation on the Korean Peninsula to an extreme pitch for a long time. Once military conflict breaks out, it is bound to escalate the crisis.
					
					A lack of confidence is the biggest hurdle lying in the way of defusing the tensions on the peninsula and building an effective multilateral security cooperation system in Northeast Asia. 
					
					All facts go to prove that efforts to promote the process for multilateral security cooperation in Northeast Asia may prove futile as long as the DPRK and the U.S. lack mutual confidence. 
					
					The reality testifies to the fact that the U.S. hard line towards the DPRK can never yield an ideal fruit. What is urgent is for the parties concerned to build confidence. 
					
					As the above-said magazine put it, the U.S. unilateral and high-handed policy is a main factor of destroying the fair international relations and fostering mistrust and antagonism, and the root cause of disturbing peace and stability. 
					
					The United States is staging madcap UFG throughout south Korea with 530 000 troops including service members of the countries that participated in the Korean War involved. 
					
					This is adversely affecting not only the peace on the peninsula but also the development of the situation in the Asia-Pacific region. 
					
					It is nonsensical to expect the situation in the region to improve without defusing the tensions on the peninsula fraught with the greatest danger of war in the region. 
					
					The U.S. should not merely talk about the peace and security in the region but show its will for peace in action.

articles.title: Japan First to Recognize Tok Islets as Korean Territory
articles.content:
Japan First to Recognize Tok Islets as Korean Territory

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Tok Islets have remained part of the Korean territory from ancient times.
					
					From the historical point of view, the Japanese and their governments had considered the islets as part of the Korean territory.
					
					During the Imjin Patriotic War (1592-1598), a Japanese commander had a Korean map marking Usan Islets (Tok Islets) and Ullung Island. In 1785 a Japanese geographer, Hayashi, drew a Korean map including Tok Islets.
					
					On September 5, 1660 a Japanese fisherman, surnamed Otani, in a letter to his colleague Murakawa, described Tok Islets as belonging to Ullung Island.  
					
					Korea's dominium over Tok Islets was also acknowledged by a Shogunate decision in January 1696 and an order of the top government body in March 1877.
					
					After the "1868 Meiji Restoration" the Japanese government had continued recognizing Korea's dominium over Tok Islets.
					
					At that time the army and navy ministries also recognized it.
					
					The Korean East Sea Chart drawn by the Navy Ministry in 1876 marks Tok Islets as Korea's and the Korean map published by the Army Ministry in 1875 shows Ullung Island and Tok Islets as Korean territory.
					
					All the facts go to prove that successive Japanese governments officially acknowledged Korea's dominium over Tok Islets and that Japan was the first state to recognize it in the world.

articles.title: Action for Settlement of Registration Fee Issue Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Action for Settlement of Registration Fee Issue Called for in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of University Student Councils in the 21st Century held a rally in Seoul on August 15 to settle the registration fee issue at which it demanded the puppet authorities implement their commitment to halve the registration fee.
					
					It was attended by more than 2 000 youth and students and citizens.
					
					At the rally speakers said that Hwang Sung Won, a student of Seoul City University, died while toiling in a work site on July 22 to earn money to pay his registration fee.
					
					Many students and citizens toiled and moiled to pay his debts caused by the money lent as school fee but Mayor of Seoul O Se Hun, managing director of the university, and the "government" did not mention even a word of consolation, they charged.
					
					They cannot remain a passive onlooker any longer to spending money for purchasing weapons to kill fellow countrymen though it should be directed to people's living including education and healthcare, etc., they held.
					
					They condemned the "government" and the "Grand National Party" for not implementing their commitment to halve the registration fee.
					
					They vowed to fight it out so that students may not die due to the registration fee in the future.

articles.title: Building of New Society for Achieving Independent Reunification Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Building of New Society for Achieving Independent Reunification Called for in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification issued a statement titled "Let us shatter war moves and reunify the country by concerted efforts of our nation" on August 15, the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					66 years have passed since the August 15 liberation but this land has not yet been freed from the rule of foreign forces, the statement deplored.
					
					The U.S. is lording it over in south Korea and let pro-U.S., pro-Japanese elements carry on war moves including joint military exercises targeted against the north, it charged.
					
					The U.S. and the sycophantic and traitorous forces can never be pardoned as they are creating such a dangerous situation that a nuclear war may break any moment due to their reckless moves for confrontation, it noted.
					
					It called for shattering all the moves of the war maniacs through a powerful anti-U.S. struggle and building a new society for achieving independent reunification under the uplifted banner of "By our nation itself".

articles.title: Stop to S. Korean Security Authorities' Conspiratorial Suppression Demanded
articles.content:
Stop to S. Korean Security Authorities' Conspiratorial Suppression Demanded

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- The Inchon Headquarters of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a press conference outside the Inchon Branch of the Intelligence Service on August 17 demanding the puppet authorities stop at once the conspiratorial suppression, according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					
					At the press conference speakers said that the "spy ring case" was faked up by the IS according to a prearranged scenario.
					
					They accused the IS of seriously encroaching upon the human rights of those allegedly suspected of the case in the course of investigation.
					
					They urged the security authorities to stop at once the suppression of the legitimate trade unions and discontinue faking up the conspiratorial case.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Forces' Extreme Violence Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Forces' Extreme Violence Slammed

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- A deputy spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea on August 16 issued a commentary denouncing the conservative forces for their extreme violence.
					
					On August 15 a member of a conservative organization committed violence against Jong Tong Yong, executive chairman of the Democratic Party, who participated in a meeting for settling the registration fee issue, the commentary recalled.
					
					This is nothing but violence against the forces which demanded cutting down of the registration fee by half and reckless terrorism against the progressive opposition parties calling for a pro-common people policy, it charged.
					
					The recent extreme violence of the conservative organizations going beyond the tolerance level can never be pardoned, it held, and continued:
					
					What merits a more serious attention is the attitude of the police shielding the rowdyism of the conservative forces, feigning ignorance of it. The police action quite contrary to the indiscriminate suppression of the meeting of progressive forces is, in fact, little short of fully revealing the fact that it is helping the conservative forces.
					
					Standing behind violent actions being perpetrated by the conservative forces under the patronage of the police are the present "government" and the "Grand National Party", it stated.

articles.title: S. Korean Christians Mourn for Ex-President
articles.content:
S. Korean Christians Mourn for Ex-President

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- South Korean Christians held a memorial service for Kim Dae Jung at the Christian Church in Seoul on Tuesday to mark the 2nd anniversary of the ex-president's death, south Korea's CBS reported. 
					
					Speakers appreciated Kim Dae Jung's contribution to the effort for the reconciliation between the south and the north of Korea and its peaceful reunification.
					
					Meanwhile, south Korean Christian organizations declared that they would have memorial services for Kim every year.

articles.title: Human Rights Violated in S. Korean Army
articles.content:
Human Rights Violated in S. Korean Army

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore recently carried an article exposing human rights abuses in the south Korean army.
					
					The article said:
					
					Outrages on human rights in the army, including the Marine Corps, have been revealed one after another. All of those who died or met mishaps in the case of the Second Division of the Marine Corps are victims of the evil barracks culture. 
					
					What a private second class, surnamed Jong, said during a military inquiry is shocking. He was examined for a shooting incident together with a private first class, surnamed Kim. 
					
					According to his statement, a senior soldier accused him of believing in Christianity and set fire to a bible under his eyes. He suffered all manners of outrages.
					
					The fact offers a glimpse of human rights abuses prevalent in the whole army. The wrong soldier spirit mainly causes such situation. The distorted view -- soldiers should stand beating -- persists in the army.    
					
					The outdated view was a serious problem in the past and it is a difficult thing for soldiers of the new generation to accept.  
					
					It has been confirmed that commanding officers are taking the lead in covering up the serious situation. The military authorities deny human rights organizations to true stories in an apparent bid to hide the structural problems of the barracks life and commanding officers' defects.

articles.title: Internet Newspaper Calls for Pooling Efforts for Korean Reunification
articles.content:
Internet Newspaper Calls for Pooling Efforts for Korean Reunification

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Minjok Tongsin, an Internet newspaper run by Korean Americans, published an article titled "Let us bring about a true liberation of the country with the effort of our nation!" on Monday.
					
					August 15 is the 66th anniversary of the Korean liberation from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule, the article said. But the Korean nation has suffered from the division of the country for more than half a century.
					
					In order to put an end to the tragedy, Koreans have held pro-reunification events to mark August 15, the article said, adding:
					
					But the present chief executive of south Korea, since he came to power, has pursued an anti-reunification and confrontation policy, impeding joint events of the compatriots at home and abroad. 
					
					The August 15 rally should serve as a new occasion for opening the way of peace and independent reunification in the spirit of the June 15 joint declaration adopted between the north and the south of the country.
					
					All compatriots should pool efforts to judge the present south Korean regime and achieve a true liberation of the country.

articles.title: Truth and Falsity
articles.content:
Truth and Falsity

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Minjok Tongsin, U.S.-resident Koreans' Internet newspaper, carried an article on August 15, 66 years after Korean liberation from the Japanese colonial rule.
					
					The article says:
					
					Today marks the 66th day of Korea's liberation from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule. We enjoyed the joy of the liberation only for 23 days. Instead of the Sun Flag, the Stars and Strips fluttered in Seoul. Since then the Korean people have suffered misfortune caused by the country's division for 66 years.
					
					In the true sense of the word, August 15 was not the day of liberation. The Korean nation has been harassed by other foreign forces' interference.
					
					The southern part of the country still remains a colony of the United States. Even the right to command wartime operations is in the hand of the U.S. army.
					
					August 15 events have been held at home and abroad in true and false ways.
					
					Since the appearance of the present regime in south Korea, the August 15 events have lost their true meaning.
					
					Ultra-rightist conservatives called for "eradication of pro-north forces" and "search and punishment of spies" at an event held on August 14 allegedly to mark the liberation anniversary.
					
					The false events are characterized by no mention about national independence, peaceful reunification, great national unity, June 15 joint declaration and October 4 declaration but about "lost 10 years".
					
					Democratic camps at home and abroad have refused to joint August 15 events sponsored by the south Korean conservatives, terming them false. 
					
					The patriotic-minded people's approach towards August 15 is different.
					
					The Solidarity for Progress, preparatory committee for the People's Power of Reforming the World, the Democratic Labor Party and other civic organizations and political parties jointly sponsored an August 15 rally for independent reunification in Seoul on Monday. The rally demonstrated their strong will to thoroughly implement the declarations, achieve national reunification, overcoming any trials and difficulties.
					
					With the 66th anniversary as an occasion, patriotic-minded compatriots at home and abroad, ardently desirous of an independent and peaceful reunification of the homeland, voiced their determination to get united, regardless of difference in ideology, thought, religious and political view and property, in order to accomplish the historic cause of reunification.
					
					What all Koreans should do now is to attain great national unity and achieve the country's peaceful reunification.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Day Observed
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Day Observed

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- A lecture took place in Mexico, a meeting in Benin and film show in Thailand from August 9 to 13 to mark the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					Ricardo Cantu Garza, coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, praised Kim Jong Il as peerlessly illustrious commander of Songun, the great defender of cause of socialism and the most experienced political elder.
					
					The Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il serves as a banner of victory of the cause of socialism and all-powerful treasured sword, he said, adding that his Songun leadership exploits would always go down in the history of Kim Il Sung's nation and human history.
					
					Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" said that the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il is the most powerful political mode guaranteeing the victorious advance of the cause of socialism and independence despite of the imperialists' high-handed and arbitrary practices which are getting more undisguised day by day.
					
					After watching the Korean film "Reply of Korea" the director of the Global Link International Holiday of Thailand noted that he came to know well that the Korean people are building a thriving nation, undeterred by any arbitrary practice and pressure of the "only super power," thanks to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il, he added.
					
					A meeting and book and photo exhibition took place in Russia to mark the above-said anniversary and the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					On display in the venues of the events were famous works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, books and photos introducing their immortal exploits and photos on advantages of the socialist educational system in the DPRK.
					
					The vice-chairman and secretary general of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK and other speakers praised the immortal exploits the President performed by defeating two imperialisms in one generation and thereby liberating the country and defending freedom and independence of the country and the nation and building a socialist power centered on the popular masses.
					
					A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting in Russia.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy released an information bulletin on August 15 to mark the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					The bulletin said in an article titled "Reason why a war did not break out on the Korean Peninsula" that a war did not break out on the Korean Peninsula because of the powerful national power of the DPRK. 
					
					It went on:
					
					Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il is the man possessed of brilliant wisdom, strategy and tactics and outstanding commanding art.
					
					The invariable policy of the peace-loving DPRK is also an important factor of preventing the war in the region.
					
					The proposals of the DPRK including the proposal for replacing the Armistice Agreement by a lasting peace treaty and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo aimed to achieve the reunification of the country by peaceful means, etc. enjoy the warm sympathy and support of the international community.
					
					The peace and security of the Korean Peninsula will be firmly preserved thanks to supreme leader Kim Jong Il, guardian of peace and justice.

articles.title: 66th Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Celebrated in Kyrgyzstan and Guinea
articles.content:
66th Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Celebrated in Kyrgyzstan and Guinea

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Lectures were given in Kyrgyzstan and Guinea on August 10 and 11 on the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					Anarbek Usupbaev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party and chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Kyrgyzstan, said that on August 15, 1945, 66 years ago the Korean people were liberated from the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists. 
					
					He went on:
					
					President Kim Il Sung, the great leader of the Korean people, laid down the line of the anti-Japanese armed struggle, founding the anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army and leading the protracted armed struggle to victory without state backing or any assistance from a regular army.
					
					After the liberation the President wisely led the Korean people for nearly half a century, building a country centered on the popular masses, the first of its kind in their history, and turning the DPRK into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defense.
					
					The Korean people are holding him in high esteem as the eternal President of the Republic and are all out to implement his behests.
					
					The Korean people are sure to build a thriving nation under Kim Jong Il's wise leadership in the near future.
					
					Abdoulaye Diallo, chairman of the Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea, said:
					
					The President led the anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory, defeating the imperialist aggressors through an organized armed struggle and paving the way for achieving national liberation which gave a good example to the people of colonial countries, adding that the President's feats would remain shining long.

articles.title: Branches of BIJI Inaugurated in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Branches of BIJI Inaugurated in Bangladesh

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- The Mymensingh, Bagerat and Tangail Branches of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea (BIJI) were inaugurated from August 13 to 15.
					
					Musharaf Karim was elected chairman of Mymensingh Branch, Anisour Rahman chairman of the Bagerat Branch and M.D. Abdul Hamid chairman of the Tangail Branch at the inaugural ceremonies.
					
					The general secretary of the Institute, in his speeches at the inaugural ceremonies, underscored the need to expand the ranks of members of the institute and intensify the study and dissemination of the Juche idea on the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, the founder of the immortal Juche idea.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Visit to China Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Visit to China Observed

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- A Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibition took place in Harbin City, China on August 15 to mark the first anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's historic visit to China.
					
					The exhibition featured famous works of the peerlessly great men, photos on Kim Jong Il's visit to China last year and his Songun leadership feats as well as books and photos introducing Songun Korea and handicrafts associated with creative talents of Koreans.
					
					Present at its opening ceremony were officials of Heilongjiang Province and Harbin City, citizens, the consul general and staff members of the DPRK Consulate General in Shenyang, members of the Exhibition General Bureau delegation and Koreans in China.
					
					Speeches were made at the ceremony.

articles.title: China, Philippines Pledge Closer Law Enforcement Cooperation
articles.content:
China, Philippines Pledge Closer Law Enforcement Cooperation

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- China and the Philippines on Tuesday agreed to seek stronger law enforcement cooperation.
					
					On the same day Bangladesh signed a MOU in capital Dhaka with Ukraine for import of wheat for five years to meet the requirement of the South Asian country.

articles.title: Chinese Official Emphasizes Importance of United Front Work
articles.content:
Chinese Official Emphasizes Importance of United Front Work

					Beijing, August 19 (KCNA) -- Du Qinglin, vice-chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, recently called for fully performing the function and role of the united front.
					
					During an inspection tour of Zhejiang and Anhui provinces, Du said the united front organization should rally all members behind the Communist Party Central Committee and encourage them to greatly contribute to promoting the cause of socialism with the Chinese characteristics.

articles.title: Rainstorms, Floods Affect 3.8 mln in China
articles.content:
Rainstorms, Floods Affect 3.8 mln in China

					Beijing, August 19 (KCNA) -- A recent wave of rainstorms and floods hitting many parts of China have killed 10 people and affected more than 3.889 million, according to statistics released Wednesday.
					
					The disasters have caused direct economic losses of 2.07 billion yuan (323 million U.S. dollars), with northern Hebei Province and northwestern Gansu and Qinghai provinces most severely affected, according to the commission.
					
					Emergency rescue measures are now being taken in the afflicted areas.

articles.title: 2012-2014 Investment Program Adopted in Moscow
articles.content:
2012-2014 Investment Program Adopted in Moscow

					Moscow, August 19 (KCNA) -- Moscow City authorities adopted an investment program for coming three years. The main targets of the investment are metro construction and traffic sector.
					
					Addressing a city government meeting on August 9, Moscow Mayor Sergei Sobyanin said the authorities decided to concentrate investment on feasible projects, not on controversial ones.
					
					The city's total investment will reach 420 billion Rbls in 2012 and over 475 billion Rbls in 2014, according the mayor's announcement.

articles.title: Cuban Paper Exposes U.S. Crimes
articles.content:
Cuban Paper Exposes U.S. Crimes

					Havana, August 19 (KCNA) -- The Cuban paper Granma on August 16 exposed the crimes of the U.S. which used napalm bombs at a time of military invasion of Playa Giron.
					
					Quoting the recently disclosed data, the paper said that there was concern that the use of napalm bombs might spark furor at that time but the U.S. government decided to use them to create the situation favorable for the mercenaries.

articles.title: 4 Killed in U.S. Drone Strike in NW Pakistan
articles.content:
4 Killed in U.S. Drone Strike in NW Pakistan

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in Afghanistan continue killing Pakistanis under the signboard of "anti-terrorism".
					
					At least four people were killed and two others injured early Tuesday morning as U.S. drones fired two missiles at a house in Miranshah of North Waziristan in Pakistan's northwest tribal area bordering Afghanistan, reported local media Duniya.

articles.title: U.S. Border Patrol Seize More than Five Tons of Marijuana in South Texas
articles.content:
U.S. Border Patrol Seize More than Five Tons of Marijuana in South Texas

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- U.S. Border Patrol said Monday they have seized more than five tons of marijuana at a south Texas checkpoint.
					
					More than 3 000 marijuana plants were discovered in the eastern part of the U.S. state of Texas on Wednesday, investigators said on Thursday.

articles.title: Disorder, Immorality and Corruption Rampant in U.S.
articles.content:
Disorder, Immorality and Corruption Rampant in U.S.

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Cases sparking social furor are occurring in the United States.
					
					Some days ago, a man was arrested while crossing a fence of the White House, with a knapsack containing explosives on his back, kicking off a row.
					
					The president was inside the building at that time, a press report said.
					
					Prior to the case, two unidentified planes flew in the sky above the Camp David on the outskirts of Washington one after another, prompting a U.S. forces plane to make an urgent sortie.
					
					Besides, a vehicle suspected of carrying explosives was detected near the building of the Defense Department to totally cordon off roads leading to it and post envelops containing white powder were reportedly sent to schools in Washington, D.C., etc. These shocking cases are occurring in an unbroken chain, throwing people into greater uneasiness and horror.
					
					A bill on allowing same sex marriage was made into a law in New York State recently, stunning the public. This brought together six states which legalized same sex marriage in the U.S.
					
					All facts go to clearly prove that the U.S. is a corrupt and degenerated society.

articles.title: Japan's Moves to Distort History Goes into Extremes
articles.content:
Japan's Moves to Distort History Goes into Extremes

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Japan is becoming all the more pronounced in its moves to distort the history. One of them is the persistent move to distort history textbooks.
					
					The ultra-right forces of Japan are frantically working to implant the militarist outlook on history and revanchism into the minds of the younger generation and prepare them as descendants of samurai to be used for wars of aggression in the future, trampling underfoot even the inviolable faith of education whose mission is to teach history as what actually happened in the past.
					
					On August 4 the Yokohama City Education Committee in Kanagawa Prefecture held an open meeting at which it decided to choose from next year the textbooks published by the Ikuhosha Publishing House as history textbooks to be used till 2015.
					
					These textbooks were compiled by the institution for the revival of education in Japan which was branched from the "Association for Making New History Textbook" which had produced distorted history textbooks. The textbooks which went through the authorities' screening late in March this year describe Tok Islets as part of Japan's territory and the Pacific War as "Greater East Asia War."
					
					It was reported that the history textbooks would be used by more than 100 000 students of city secondary schools from the next year, according to the decision of the Yokohama City Education Committee.
					
					In the meantime, the textbooks which objectively describe historical facts to a certain degree are being pushed back due to the intrigues and pressure of the ultra-right forces.
					
					This reality goes to clearly prove that the moves of the Japanese ultra-right reactionaries to implant the militarist idea into the minds of the younger generation have reached an extreme phase.

articles.title: Japan to Develop Unmanned Plane
articles.content:
Japan to Develop Unmanned Plane

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Japan is working hard to develop unmanned reconnaissance plane as part of its moves to intensify espionage against other countries.
					
					The Ministry of Defense is planning to push forward the independent development of unmanned plane, the Japanese Asahi Shimbun said on August 17.
					
					One million yen will reportedly be spent in the present fiscal year alone for survey.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Japan
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Japan

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- A 5.9-magnitude earthquake hit the Kanto area of Japan on August 17.
					
					The epicenter was at 10 km deep in waters off the eastern area.

articles.title: Nigerian President Promises Uninterrupted Power Supply before 2015
articles.content:
Nigerian President Promises Uninterrupted Power Supply before 2015

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Nigerian President Goodluck Jonathan on Tuesday re-assured that his Administration remained fully committed to the attainment of uninterrupted power supply before the end of its tenure.
					
					He gave the assurance at an audience with members of the Board of the Niger Delta Power Holding Company (NDPHC), led by Vice- President Namadi Sambo, at the State House, Abuja.
					
					The Federal Government would do everything possible to ensure that all its plans and projects to guarantee stable power supply were successfully implemented, he said.

articles.title: Angolan President Calls for New Economic Order in Southern Africa
articles.content:
Angolan President Calls for New Economic Order in Southern Africa

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Angolan President Jose Eduardo dos Santos on Wednesday called for a new economic order in southern Africa.  He made this appeal at the ongoing 31st Southern African Development Community summit in Luanda.
					
					The Angolan leader expressed his country's interest to boost the development of infrastructures which he said would stimulate the economic growth, trade, investment and development in southern Africa. 
					
					The integration of the continent is the final goal, said the president, calling for a hard work and responsibility within the community.

articles.title: Kenya Seeks to Scale up Forest Coverage
articles.content:
Kenya Seeks to Scale up Forest Coverage

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- Kenyan Prime Minister Raila Odinga on Wednesday called on nationals to plant trees to scale up forest coverage.
					
					Odinga expressed fears that the country was paying heavily for failing to conserve and restore the degraded environment as severe drought and floods have become a common occurrence.
					
					He commended the private sector for their contribution towards the environmental conservation initiative but challenged the youth to volunteer and participate in greening the land.

articles.title: Belarus Company Condemns U.S. Sanctions
articles.content:
Belarus Company Condemns U.S. Sanctions

					Pyongyang, August 20 (KCNA) -- A company of Belarus recently condemned the U.S. sanctions against the country's businesses.
					
					Referring to the U.S. Finance Department's decision for new sanctions, the company termed them a token of U.S. businesses' irresponsible rivalry.
					
					The decision will only result in hurting U.S. businesses and encouraging other countries' producers to give up U.S. dollar settlement, said the company.

articles.title: Iranian President on Relations with Russia
articles.content:
Iranian President on Relations with Russia

					Tehran, August 19 (KCNA) -- Iran and Russia are close to each other and the development of the bilateral relations conforms to mutual interests, said Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad.  
					
					In a recent TV interview, he said the Bushehr Atomic Power Plant built by Russia in Iran is a symbol of the bilateral cooperation.
					
					Iran will take all necessary measures to ensure the plant's security, said the president.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il pasa la estacion ferroviaria fronteriza de Khasan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il pasa la estacion ferroviaria fronteriza de Khasan

					Pyongyang, 20 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, paso el dia 20 por la manana la estacion ferroviaria fronteriza rusa de Khasan en el trayecto de su viaje para realizar una visita extraoficial a las regiones de Siberia y Lejano Oriente de la Federacion Rusa cumplimentando la invitacion del Presidente ruso Dmitri Anatolievich Medvedev.
					
					El fue acogido en la estacion por Viktor Ishayev, delegado plenipotenciario del presidente en la Zona Federal del Lejano Oriente, quien llego ahi para guiar al primero.
					
					Le recibieron tambien los cuadros del centro, territorio maritimo, ciudad y municipio como Serguei Mijailovich Darikin, gobernador del Territorio Maritimo, Valery Sukhinin, embajador ruso en Corea, Irina Skorobogatova, vicegobernadora del Territorio Maritimo.
					
					Cuando llego a la estacion de Khasan el tren en que viajaba Kim Jong Il, subieron al vagon los cuadros de recepcion para saludarle.
					
					Por el encargo de D. A. Medvedev, Viktor Ishayev y otros cuadros dieron una calida bienvenida al Dirigente destacando que el primero, quien presta profunda atencion a la amistad Rusia-Corea, les ha enviado para recibir a ese ultimo.
					
					Continuaron que la presente visita de Kim Jong Il a Rusia marcara un hito historico para situar en la nueva etapa mas alta las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises.
					
					Kim Jong Il expreso agradecimiento a los cuadros del centro y la region y otros habitantes por haberle acogido con hospitalidad, diciendo que le complace mucho la oportunidad de presenciar directamente durante esta visita los exitos que logra el laborioso e inteligente pueblo ruso.
					
					Serguei Mijailovich Darikin entrego a Kim Jong Il un souvenir a nombre del Gobierno del Territorio Maritimo y los habitantes del area.
					
					Momentos despues, el Dirigente partio hacia su destino recibiendo el saludo de despedida de los cuadros rusos.
					
					Anteriormente, el partio de la patria para realizar su visita extraoficial a las regiones de Siberia y Lejano Oriente de Rusia.
					
					Le acompanan en la ocasion Kim Yong Chun, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, Kang Sok Ju, miembro del BP del CC del PTC y viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Ministros, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun y Thae Jong Su, miembros suplentes del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del BP y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Pak Pong Ju, primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, O Su Yong, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Norte, Kim Kye Gwan, primer viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Kim Yong Jae, embajador coreano en Rusia y Sim Kuk Ryong, consul general coreano acreditado en Najodka.
					
					La presente visita del Dirigente a la Federacion Rusa, otro evento en el cumplimiento de la causa de la paz y seguridad del mundo y la independencia de la humanidad, constituira una ocasion historica para fortalecer la amistad Corea-Rusia, que continua con firmeza de siglo en siglo, y para estimular la lucha de todos los militares y civiles por construir un Estado prospero socialista.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de respuesta al presidente belaruso
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de respuesta al presidente belaruso

					Pyongyang, 20 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio este sabado un mensaje de respuesta al presidente de la Republica de Belarus, Aleksandr Lukashenko.
					
					La misiva va como sigue:
					
					Expreso mi agradecimiento a Usted por haberme enviado un mensaje de consuelo por motivo de danos por inundaciones en algunas zonas de nuestro pais.
					
					Quisiera aprovechar esta oportunidad para desearle a usted exitos en su trabajo para la estabilidad economica del pais.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il realizara visita extraoficial a varias regiones rusas
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il realizara visita extraoficial a varias regiones rusas

					Pyongyang, 20 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, realizara una visita extraoficial a las regiones de Siberia y Lejano Oriente de la Federacion Rusa cumplimentando la invitacion del Presidente ruso D. A. Medvedev. 
					
					Durante la visita, tendra lugar la cumbre bilateral.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe regalo del jefe delegacion vietnamita
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe regalo del jefe delegacion vietnamita

					Pyongyang, 20 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio regalo que le dirigiera el jefe de la delegacion del Ministerio de Defensa de Vietnam, de visita en Corea.
					
					El teniente coronel Nguyen Chi Vinh, viceministro de esa cartera y jefe de la delegacion, lo entrego el dia 19  a un funcionario coreano.

articles.title: Rusia dona alimentos a la RPDC
articles.content:
Rusia dona alimentos a la RPDC

					Pyongyang, 20 de agosto (ACNC) -- Llego el dia 19 al puerto de Hungnam el primer barco cargado de alimentos, segun la decision del gobierno de la Federacion Rusa de suministrar gratuitamente 50 mil toneladas de alimentos a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Seguiran llegando otros barcos. 
					
					Ademas, se suministran a Corea los alimentos equivalentes a 5 millones de US$ que dona el gobierno ruso a traves del Programa Mundial de Alimentos. 
					
					La ayuda alimentaria gratuita del gobierno ruso es una muestra de las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion existentes entre los gobiernos y los pueblos de ambos paises.

articles.title: Confianza mutua es clave por la paz de la Peninsula Coreana
articles.content:
Confianza mutua es clave por la paz de la Peninsula Coreana

					Pyongyang, 20 de agosto (ACNC) -- La actual situacion internacional se caracteriza por la creacion de la coyuntura de alivio y el cambio positivo, segun el cual se coordinan en lo politico varios problemas conflictivos regionales a traves de las negociaciones.
					
					Pero, solo en la Peninsula Coreana no se han eliminado la tension y el peligro de guerra.
					
					Al respecto, la revista china "Liaowang" No.32, en su articulo intitulado "El eslabon pendiente en asegurar la seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana es la falta de la confianza", senala como sigue:
					
					Tras los contactos entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea, en particular, entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Estados Unidos realizados recientemente dieron la impresion de haber aparecido una clara sintoma de distension en la Peninsula Coreana en que se habia creado en 2010 una grave preocupacion hasta extenderse al borde de la guerra y despunto la aurora de reanudacion de las conversaciones a 6 bandas.
					
					Pero, las personas no pueden menos que ser prudentes ante la futura evolucion de la Peninsula Coreana a la luz de la circulacion periodica de la  "conversaciones-crisis-conversaciones-crisis".
					
					La incertidumbre y la peligrosidad real de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana tienen su fuente en la falta de confianza entre las partes en conflictos.
					
					Falta la confianza mutua entre la RPDC y EE.UU.
					
					La parte norteamericana no respeta plenamente la existencia real del poder coreano. EE.UU. la considero durante largo tiempo como Estado de otra clase en lugar de prestar atencion en la altura estrategica a la demanda de la RPDC en cuanto a sus intereses y seguridad.
					
					La politica de EE.UU. sobre la RPDC es, en su esencia, cercarla y aplastarla en lo politico, sancionarla en lo economico y acosarla en lo estrategico mediante los ejercicios militares conjuntos como "Ulji Freedom Guardian".
					
					Ademas, aplica sin titubeo la politica de llevar la situacion al borde de la guerra. Durante el mandato de Clinton se creo temporalmente el indicio del alivio de tension en esa peninsula, pero todavia sigue el matiz conflictivo en las relaciones binacionales. 
					
					En particular, el aumento armamentista y los ejercicios militares de EE.UU. agravan al extremo durante largo tiempo la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					El choque militar engendrara la escalada de la crisis. La falta de confianza deviene el maximo eslabon pendiente que no posibilita eliminar radicalmente la tension en la Peninsula Coreana y preparar el eficiente sistema de cooperacion para la seguridad multilateral en la region del Nordeste Asiatico.
					
					Todos los hechos demuestran que por la falta de confianza mutua entre la RPDC y EE.UU. y entre la primera y el Sur de Corea, los esfuerzos por promover el proceso de cooperacion para la seguridad multilateral del Nordeste Asiatico podrian ser formales.
					
					La realidad prueba que la linea intransigente de EE.UU. sobre la RPDC no posibilita surtir el efecto  ideal.
					
					Lo perentorio es establecer la confianza entre las partes interesadas.
					
					Como muestra el articulo, la politica unilateral y de despotismo de EE.UU. es el motivo importante que afecta las sanas relaciones internacionales y promueve la desconfianza, la antipatia y la confrontacion entre los paises y constituye la causa raigal que destruye la paz y la estabilidad.
					
					Ahora, EE.UU. libra freneticamente en toda la extension surcoreana los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Ulji Freedom Guardian" movilizando 530 mil uniformados juntos con los militares de varios paises participantes en la pasada guerra coreana, lo que da la grave influencia negativa a la paz de la Peninsula Coreana  y al desarrollo de la situacion de la region de Asia-Pacifico.
					
					EE.UU. debe mostrar su voluntad de paz no con la palabra sino con la accion practica.
